Name: Country
Description: The most common objects are the current and former independent nations, potentially including composite entities such as empires. It can also be used for autonomous entities within such a composite, such as the four current constituent countries (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland, and Wales) of the United Kingdom.

Properties.Name: Calling Code
Properties.Description: The country code needed to make a telephone call to this country from another country.

Properties.Name: First level divisions
Properties.Description: The first level administrative divisions of this country, typically regions, states, provinces, etc.

Properties.Name: Form of Government
Properties.Description: The form or style of government (i.e. federal republic, monarchy, etc.) of this country.

Properties.Name: Fourth level divisions
Properties.Description: Fourth-level administrative divisions of this country. Administratively, fourth-level divisions have three levels of administration between their governments and the national government.

Properties.Name: Internet TLD
Properties.Description: The top-level domain(s) specific to this country.

Properties.Name: Second level divisions
Properties.Description: The second level administrative divisions of this country, typically counties, cantons, departments, districts, etc...

Properties.Name: Third level divisions
Properties.Description: Third-level administrative divisions of this country. Administratively, third-level divisions have two levels of administration between their governments and the national government.
